Through original programming, documentaries, and expert-led discussions, MHTN aims to increase awareness, provide valuable information, and encourage open conversations about mental well-being.

programme.title: Quo Vadis TV
programme.desc: Quo Vadis TV is committed to sharing the Biblical message in a way that makes Christian living practical, realistic, and attainable. Our theme is summarized the question: "where are you going?" Our Aim with this inquiry is to help people find orientation and find the path back to God.

Our theme is summarized the question: "where are you going?" Our Aim with this inquiry is to help people find orientation and find the path back to God.

programme.title: The Apartment
programme.desc: Insurance worker C.C. Baxter (Jack Lemmon) lends his Upper West Side apartment to company bosses to use for extramarital affairs. When his manager Mr. Sheldrake (Fred MacMurray) begins using Baxter's apartment in exchange for promoting him, Baxter is disappointed to learn that Sheldrake's mistress is Fran Kubelik (Shirley MacLaine), the elevator girl at work whom Baxter is interested in himself. Soon Baxter must decide between the girl he loves and the advancement of his career.

programme.title: The Bells of St. Mary's
programme.desc: Father O'Malley (Bing Crosby) is transferred to the Roman Catholic inner-city school St. Mary's, where he quickly falls into conflict with its headmistress, Sister Mary (Ingrid Bergman). Their primary disagreement has to do with the deteriorating school itself. Father O'Malley feels it should be abandoned and the children sent to other schools. Sister Mary and the other nuns, however, believe there is still hope, possibly in the form of charity from a wealthy business owner (Henry Travers).

programme.title: The Last Hunt
programme.desc: Sandy McKenzie (Stewart Granger) has a long history of hunting buffalo, but now that the herds have been so dramatically thinned out, he's come to regret it. Nevertheless, he partners up with Charles Gilson (Robert Taylor) for one last hunt that proves to be the worst of them all. Charles is a twisted, insensate killer of both buffalo and Indians -- and when he kidnaps and abuses a young Indian girl (Debra Paget), Sandy is pushed to the breaking point.

programme.title: Fighting Westerner
programme.desc: Larry Sutton (Randolph Scott) becomes chief engineer at the Ballard radium mine after the mysterious death of the former chief. Asked by the sheriff to assist in the investigation of the death, Larry learns that his own brother-in-law, as well as the nephew (Howard Wilson) and niece (Kathleen Burke) of the mine owner, Jim Ballard (George F. Marion), are all suspects. When Mrs. Ballard (Florence Roberts) returns from a trip and is not allowed to see Jim, Larry takes an active role in the case.

programme.desc: Paid programming.

programme.title: The Fatal Mallet
programme.desc: Three men play dirty tricks to charm a beautiful young woman.

programme.title: Blazing Across the Pecos
programme.desc: The Durango Kid attempts to thwart an outlaw's plot to turn peaceful Indians against neighboring settlers.

programme.title: Through the Bible With Les Feldick
programme.desc: Les Feldick, an Oklahoma farmer and rancher with a special gift for teaching the Bible; his simple and nondenominational approach on the program "Through the Bible with Les Feldick" has reached millions around the world with the Gospel of Grace.

programme.title: Learn More About Medicare Advantage Plans from Humana
programme.desc: Are you making the most of your Medicare coverage? In this program you will learn about the variety of Humana Medicare plans designed to fit your needs, your lifestyle, and your budget.

programme.desc: Billie Jo discovers that her late father wanted her to be a doctor.

Charles is a twisted, insensate killer of both buffalo and Indians -- and when he kidnaps and abuses a young Indian girl (Debra Paget), Sandy is pushed to the breaking point.

programme.title: Cripple Creek
programme.desc: A federal agent (George Montgomery) and two colleagues infiltrate a gang of gold-rush gold smugglers.

programme.title: Colt .45
programme.desc: While gun purveyor Steve Farrell (Randolph Scott) shows off the latest revolver innovation, a Colt .45 repeating handgun, to Sheriff Harris (Alan Hale), outlaw prisoner Jason Brett (Zachary Scott) grabs a pair and hightails it out of town -- and the sheriff jails Farrell as a likely partner in crime. But during Farrell's incarceration, Brett goes on an unstoppable rampage. Farrell is released, and must stop the outlaw with the assistance of Walking Bear (Chief Thundercloud) and the Colt .45.

programme.title: Four Daughters
programme.desc: The Lemp daughters -- Ann (Priscilla Lane), Kay (Rosemary Lane), Thea (Lola Lane) and Emma (Gale Page) -- belong to a family of talented musicians, with their father, Adam (Claude Rains), at the helm. To bring in extra income, the Lemps rent rooms in the house, which brings in composer Felix Deitz (Jeffrey Lynn) and pianist Mickey Borden (John Garfield). Since the daughters are all of marrying age and the men are bachelors, complications arise when love enters the household.

programme.title: The Homecoming: A Christmas Story
programme.desc: On Christmas Eve 1933, a rural Virginia clan, the Waltons, are preparing to celebrate the holiday. But patriarch John Walton (Andrew Duggan), who has gone off to the big city in search of work, still hasn't returned home, and a heavy snowstorm only adds more cause for worry. Teenage son John-Boy (Richard Thomas) tries to distract his siblings by explaining the real meaning of Christmas to them, before his mother (Patricia Neal) finally sends John-Boy out to find his father.

programme.title: Made for Each Other
programme.desc: While on a business trip, an ambitious, young lawyer immediately falls in love with a stranger. They wed the following day, and tragedy soon strikes.

programme.title: The Desert Trail
programme.desc: John Scott (John Wayne) is a rodeo rider, assisted by his buddy Kansas Charlie (Eddy Chandler). But while the duo is settling a debt with their promoter, Farnsworth (Henry Hall), thieves Pete (Al Ferguson) and Jim (Paul Fix) murder and rob Farnsworth and manage to pin the crimes on John and Charlie. The accused then flee, assume two new identities, take up with a shopkeeper named Anne (Mary Kornman) and set out to clear their names and bring the real killers to justice.

programme.title: The Girl from San Lorenzo
programme.desc: Cisco and Pancho set out to clear their names in a series of stage robberies committed by two thugs who are impersonating them.

programme.desc: Paid programming.

programme.desc: A Canadian government wildlife expert (Stephan Dunne) tames a white dog trained to fight by brutal masters.

programme.title: Kazan
programme.desc: A Canadian government wildlife expert (Stephan Dunne) tames a white dog trained to fight by brutal masters.

programme.title: Colt .45
programme.desc: While gun purveyor Steve Farrell (Randolph Scott) shows off the latest revolver innovation, a Colt .45 repeating handgun, to Sheriff Harris (Alan Hale), outlaw prisoner Jason Brett (Zachary Scott) grabs a pair and hightails it out of town -- and the sheriff jails Farrell as a likely partner in crime. But during Farrell's incarceration, Brett goes on an unstoppable rampage. Farrell is released, and must stop the outlaw with the assistance of Walking Bear (Chief Thundercloud) and the Colt .45.

programme.title: The Man From Laramie
programme.desc: Will Lockhart (James Stewart) comes to the ranch town of Coronado looking for the man who is selling rifles to the Apaches, because his brother was killed with one. There he runs into Alec Waggoman (Donald Crisp), an aging rancher with a violent son named Dave (Alex Nicol). A conflict between Dave and Vic (Arthur Kennedy), Waggoman's top aid, helps Lockhart uncover the source of the rifles -- and also gets him involved in the power struggles at the Waggoman ranch.

programme.title: Mr. Soft Touch
programme.desc: A World War II veteran, Joe Miracle (Glenn Ford), comes home to find that his nightclub has been taken over by gangsters and his business partner has been killed. After reclaiming the money that is rightfully his, he is forced to hide out in a settlement house due to a case of mistaken identity. There, he befriends the house manager, Jenny Jones (Evelyn Keyes). While being pursued by gangsters and a persistent journalist, Joe learns a valuable lesson about altruism.

programme.title: Going My Way
programme.desc: Father Charles O'Malley (Bing Crosby) is an easy-going, golf-playing young priest whose entry into a tough neighborhood parish in midtown Manhattan is viewed with skepticism from all quarters, especially the aging Father Fitzgibbon (Barry Fitzgerald). While dealing with some unfinished business from his former life in the form of an old flame who now sings at the Metropolitan Opera (Rise Stevens), Father O'Malley inspires the youth of his parish by forming a boys choir.

programme.title: The Burning Hills
programme.desc: Cattle rancher Trace Jordan (Tab Hunter) discovers the dead body of his brother and seeks out Joe Sutton (Ray Teal), the cattle baron he knows killed him. Jordan kills Sutton in an act of self-defense during a shoot-out, but is also wounded and flees. He attempts to escape as Sutton's henchmen pursue him, and is soon joined by a half-Mexican woman named Maria (Natalie Wood), whose father had also been killed by Sutton. Eventually Sutton's men find them, and a confrontation occurs.

programme.title: Cattle Queen of Montana
programme.desc: When defiant female rancher Sierra Nevada Jones (Barbara Stanwyck) sweeps into Montana, she receives a hostile welcome from a tribe of Native Americans who attack her cattle and leave her father dead. Kindly Indian brave Colorados (Lance Fuller) and government officer Farrell (Ronald Reagan) help Sierra fight for her land against treacherous locals like the envious Tom McCord (Gene Evans), a neighboring rancher determined to cheat Jones out of her property and drive her back to Texas.

programme.desc: Paid programming.

programme.title: Out West With the Peppers
programme.desc: A woman (Dorothy Peterson) takes her children (Edith Fellows, Dorothy Ann Seese) westward, where they proceed to get into trouble at a lumber camp.

programme.title: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Reb Thomas stands accused of murdering Dan Bolton, although Earp suspects a frame-up, and despite Judge Tobin's efforts to hold a swift trial, one juror refuses to agree with the others.

programme.title: The Man From Laramie
programme.desc: Will Lockhart (James Stewart) comes to the ranch town of Coronado looking for the man who is selling rifles to the Apaches, because his brother was killed with one. There he runs into Alec Waggoman (Donald Crisp), an aging rancher with a violent son named Dave (Alex Nicol). A conflict between Dave and Vic (Arthur Kennedy), Waggoman's top aid, helps Lockhart uncover the source of the rifles -- and also gets him involved in the power struggles at the Waggoman ranch.

programme.title: Stars in My Crown
programme.desc: Man of God Josiah Gray (Joel McCrea) is determined to bring religion to the people of Walesburg, a dusty southern town still healing from the Civil War. Though initially Josiah must hold his parishioners at gunpoint, in time he wins over the community and marries his organist, Harriet (Ellen Drew). As the years pass, a number of situations arise, including a typhoid outbreak and a hostile mob, in which Josiah must prove that God is the only force that can restore peace in Walesburg.

programme.title: Desk Set
programme.desc: Bunny Watson (Katharine Hepburn) is a library reference clerk stuck in a dead-end relationship with a boring television executive (Gig Young). Her life is thrown into turmoil when computer expert Richard Summers (Spencer Tracy) enters it. He has been assigned with automating her department, and she is fearful that Summers' new computers will automate her out of a job. She despises him at first, but eventually each of the two start to fall for the other's charms and strong personalities.

programme.title: The Shop Around the Corner
programme.desc: Alfred Kralik (James Stewart) and Klara Novak (Margaret Sullavan) are employees at Matuschek and Company, a general store in Budapest. Klara and Alfred are constantly at odds with each other, butting heads and disagreeing on almost everything. Both are enamored of their respective pen pals, who serve as welcome distractions in their lives. Little do they know, they are each the other's pen pal and, despite outward differences, have unwittingly fallen in love through their letters.

programme.title: A Very Brady Christmas
programme.desc: Mike (Robert Reed) and Carol Brady (Florence Henderson) are looking forward to spending the Christmas holiday with their six adult children and their friend and former housekeeper, Alice (Ann B. Davis), but various issues may keep them apart. Every Brady sibling has a set of problems, marital or otherwise. However, their own difficulties are eclipsed when their father is trapped in a collapsed building. For the Bradys to have a happy holiday, it's going to take a Christmas miracle.

programme.title: Loan Shark
programme.desc: An ex-convict (George Raft) acts tough at a tire plant to expose a racket preying on workers.

programme.title: A Day's Pleasure
programme.desc: Charlie and his family have an adventure on land and sea.

As the years pass, a number of situations arise, including a typhoid outbreak and a hostile mob, in which Josiah must prove that God is the only force that can restore peace in Walesburg.

programme.title: Westward the Women
programme.desc: There's a deficit of good, honest women in the West, and Roy Whitman (John McIntire) wants to change that. His solution is to bring a caravan of over 100 mail-order brides from Chicago to California. It will be a long, difficult and dangerous journey for the women. So Whitman hires hardened, cynical Buck Wyatt (Robert Taylor) to be their guide across the inhospitable frontier. But as disaster strikes on the trail, Buck just might discover that these women are stronger than he thinks.

programme.title: Miracle on 34th Street
programme.desc: In this Christmas classic, an old man going by the name of Kris Kringle (Edmund Gwenn) fills in for an intoxicated Santa in Macy's annual Thanksgiving Day parade. Kringle proves to be such a hit that he is soon appearing regularly at the chain's main store in midtown Manhattan. When Kringle surprises customers and employees alike by claiming that he really is Santa Claus, it leads to a court case to determine his mental health and, more importantly, his authenticity.

programme.title: Pocketful of Miracles
programme.desc: Beggar Apple Annie (Bette Davis) learns that her daughter, escorted by an aristocratic suitor, plans to visit. It's great news -- except that she has tricked her daughter into believing she is a wealthy socialite. Fearing her true identity will disappoint, Annie petitions a superstitious mobster (Glenn Ford), who thinks the apples she sells are lucky, for help. Hesitant at first, the mafioso is persuaded by his girlfriend (Hope Lange) to disguise Annie, if only long enough to fool her daughter.

programme.title: Bachelor Mother
programme.desc: Polly Paris (Ginger Rogers) accidentally stumbles into motherhood after discovering an abandoned baby on the steps of an orphanage. Believing the baby is Polly's, department store owner J.B. Merlin (Charles Coburn) and his son David (David Niven) offer Polly a job -- but only if she takes responsibility for the child. Unemployed and in need of work, Polly accepts and all seems well, until her increasingly romantic relationship with David raises suspicions about the child's paternity.

programme.title: Road to Bali
programme.desc: In this musical, Harold (Bob Hope) and George (Bing Crosby) are two vaudeville performers in Australia. After they realize their local gal pals intend to marry them, they sign up for a diving expedition led by the local island prince, Ken Arok (Murvyn Vye). They soon meet the prince's sister, Lalah (Dorothy Lamour), who rules a beautiful island. When their dive uncovers a jewel-filled chest, Ken tries to steal both the treasure and Lalah's throne, and the trio is forced into hiding.

programme.title: A Dog's Life
programme.desc: Charlie rescues a stray from other dogs, and together they meet Edna after finding a wallet full of cash.

programme.title: Shotgun
programme.desc: A deputy sheriff (Sterling Hayden) seeks justice with a woman (Yvonne De Carlo), a bounty hunter (Zachary Scott) and a sawed-off shotgun.

programme.title: Bachelor Mother
programme.desc: Polly Paris (Ginger Rogers) accidentally stumbles into motherhood after discovering an abandoned baby on the steps of an orphanage. programme.title: Kansas Pacific
programme.desc: With the American Civil War looming, construction of the Pacific railroad is being held up in Kansas, sabotaged by Confederate sympathizers. The government dispatches an Army engineer, John Nelson (Sterling Hayden), to oversee construction, and he initially rubs the wrong way both his proud boss (Barton MacLane) and his boss's feisty daughter (Eve Miller). Eventually, though, both fall for Nelson's charms, and the hero seeks to uncover the Southern rat so he can lead the Union men due west.

programme.title: Bells of Rosarita
programme.desc: Shortly after circus owner Sue Farnum (Dale Evans), her assistant, Gabby (George "Gabby" Hayes), and her late father's ex-partner, Slim Phillips (Addison Richards), accidentally interrupt the filming of a movie starring singing cowboy Roy Rogers (Roy Rogers), Slim is kidnapped. Sue suspects that William Ripley (Grant Withers), a crooked businessman who's trying to steal her circus, is behind the kidnapping. While Sue and Gabby set up a special performance, Roy tracks Slim's kidnappers.

programme.title: The Great Awakening with Dr. Rodney Howard-Browne
Paid Programming
programme.desc: Paid programming.

programme.title: Animal Rescue
programme.desc: Visiting Phoenix Zoo; training animals to be school ambassadors; saving and rehabilitating raccoons.

programme.title: Dog Tales
programme.desc: Dog training school; breed profile: Poodle.

programme.title: Think Big
programme.desc: Children are the future -- and so are their inventions, which is why "Think Big" could be an important show. It features young inventors competing to see who can come up with the most-innovative invention. Each episode features two teams in the Think Tank -- a studio filled with art supplies and construction materials -- who brainstorm and choose materials before sketching, designing and building a prototype to be presented to a judge, who determines a winner. The champions earn bragging rights and the coveted Genius Cup.

programme.title: Biz Kids
programme.desc: "Biz Kids" is an educational television show that teaches financial education and entrepreneurship to a preteen audience. It uses sketch comedy and young actors to explain basic economic concepts.

programme.title: Sports Stars of Tomorrow
programme.desc: Profiles of the top rookie, college and high-school talent in sports; current athletes share their experiences, advice and personal impressions of the road to stardom.

programme.title: America's Heartland
programme.desc: Much of the food Americans eat is produced by farmers and ranchers in the country's heartland, but many people don't know how it's produced. "America's Heartland" provides information about the people and processes responsible for the availability of food and fuel across the country and around the world. The show's reporters and producers tell stories in topics that include farm families, consumer issues, animal welfare and crop sustainability. Some episodes also take the show abroad to countries such as Egypt and Taiwan to show the impact American agriculture has on the global economy.

programme.title: In Old Cheyenne
programme.desc: Newspaper reporter Steve Blane (Roy Rogers) is sent to Cheyenne, Wyo., to write about frontier outlaw Arapahoe Brown (George "Gabby" Hayes). But as Blane spends time in the cow town, he realizes that the conventional wisdom is all wrong. Arapahoe has been made a scapegoat for crimes perpetrated by power-hungry rancher Sam Drummond (George Rosener). As Blane attempts to report the truth, he finds himself caught in the middle of a dangerous feud between cattlemen and settlers.

programme.title: Cheyenne Rides Again
programme.desc: Cattlemen send an undercover cowboy (Tom Tyler) to bust an outlaw gang.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Stacey manages to find a Thiokol Swamp Spryte, a rare all-terrain vehicle with a distinct footprint, and rolls it into the shop.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: The Thiokol Swamp Spryte is back in the shop for some much-needed restoration, and replacing the aluminum skin so she will float again; Stacey rolls in the Lil' Red Wagon for some new suspension and 50 years of Skyjacker history.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Stacey digs into the unique story of Painless Performance and how they went from making wiring harnesses in a garage to one of the most influential companies in the automotive aftermarket.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Stacey takes a look at the supercar, McLaren M6GT; with only a handful made, the originals are collectors' items; Stacey reveals the new M6GT component car that can be built from Retroformance.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: The M6GT replica is back in the shop, and it gets serious as Stacey stuffs a 600+ HP Kaase engine into the aluminum monocoque and layers it with an exquisite bundle of snakes exhaust system from GP Headers. . If you've ever dreamed of owning a modern mid-engine car with the look of a classic McLaren, this kit is for you!

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Showing people how to take the ultimate picture of their project; Stacey sits down with KICKER to look at how the audio world has changed.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Stacey tackles the tired old engine and transmission of the 1999 Dodge Li'l Red Wagon truck.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Whether it's an impossible dream build or installing the latest in aftermarket parts, Gearz host Stacey David can design, fabricate and put it together while helping you learn how to do it yourself.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Stacey and crew take everyone to one of the most amazing drag racing events in the country, the "Night Under Fire" in Norwalk, Ohio.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Stacey rolls in a well-worn '59 Chevy Apache pickup and shows how to approach a project, whether you are keeping it original or planning on modifying it.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Stacey digs into building a brand-new bed for the '59 Apache right beside the old one!

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Stacey goes out on the rails to take a look at the restoration of the 576 Steam Locomotive.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: The Thiokol Swamp Spryte is back in the shop for some much-needed restoration, and replacing the aluminum skin so she will float again; Stacey rolls in the Lil' Red Wagon for some new suspension and 50 years of Skyjacker history.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Stacey digs into the Joe Dirt side of things and how an old, beat up Daytona made it cool to drive old, rusty junk! After that, he shows what it takes to make a high-end replica of a down-and-dirty car.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Stacey demonstrates how to change a four-headlight classic Chevy truck into a two-headlight classic Chevy truck, just by changing some sheet metal. Is it as easy as it looks, or are there some hidden challenges waiting to bite you?

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Stacey takes an old, beat-up '66 Mustang and puts some pep back in Its step. He shows you how to replace an old automatic transmission with a quick-shifting Tremec T5 5-speed, and how to lift an old cab or body off a frame without destroying it.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: What do you get when you take a 4x4 diesel pickup, toss in over 2000hp and mix it with some serious bling? The definition of show and go! Stacey looks at a new twist on tool storage, and sets up a Jeep Gladiator for all your outdoor adventure needs!

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: The Stunt Double is back in the shop for its much anticipated reveal and payoff! Inspired by the legendary FALL GUY truck, the Stunt Double is a ground up, frame off build of a classic square body Chevy truck that pays tribute to the stunt world.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Stacey rolls in one of the most iconic show cars of the 1970's, the MOD ROD. After that, he shows how to properly disassemble the cab or body of your project, and pre-fit some new components at the same time.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Stacey rolls in a 1970's Datsun 240Z! Follow along as he digs into the history of these legendary cars and shows some of the great ways to deal with the fragile parts and panels. The old Z cars are still out there. Now is the time to get one going!

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Stacey rolls in a 1970's Datsun 240Z! Follow along as he digs into the history of these legendary cars and shows some of the great ways to deal with the fragile parts and panels. The old Z cars are still out there. Now is the time to get one going!

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Stacey David takes automobile modification to a new level in "Gearz," pushing the limits of creativity and logic by building one-of-a-kind vehicles that defy conventional wisdom. Hot rods, off-road four wheelers, all-terrain types -- if it has an engine and a way to steer it, David, the original host of the popular TV series "Trucks!" brings it to life.

programme.desc: Stacey demonstrates how to change a four-headlight classic Chevy truck into a two-headlight classic Chevy truck, just by changing some sheet metal. Is it as easy as it looks, or are there some hidden challenges waiting to bite you?

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Stacey takes an old, beat-up '66 Mustang and puts some pep back in Its step. He shows you how to replace an old automatic transmission with a quick-shifting Tremec T5 5-speed, and how to lift an old cab or body off a frame without destroying it.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: What do you get when you take a 4x4 diesel pickup, toss in over 2000hp and mix it with some serious bling? The definition of show and go! Stacey looks at a new twist on tool storage, and sets up a Jeep Gladiator for all your outdoor adventure needs!

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: The Stunt Double is back in the shop for its much anticipated reveal and payoff! Inspired by the legendary FALL GUY truck, the Stunt Double is a ground up, frame off build of a classic square body Chevy truck that pays tribute to the stunt world.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Stacey rolls in one of the most iconic show cars of the 1970's, the MOD ROD. After that, he shows how to properly disassemble the cab or body of your project, and pre-fit some new components at the same time.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Stacey rolls in a 1970's Datsun 240Z! Follow along as he digs into the history of these legendary cars and shows some of the great ways to deal with the fragile parts and panels. The old Z cars are still out there. Now is the time to get one going!

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Stacey rolls in a 1970's Datsun 240Z! Follow along as he digs into the history of these legendary cars and shows some of the great ways to deal with the fragile parts and panels. The old Z cars are still out there. Now is the time to get one going!

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Stacey David takes automobile modification to a new level in "Gearz," pushing the limits of creativity and logic by building one-of-a-kind vehicles that defy conventional wisdom. Hot rods, off-road four wheelers, all-terrain types -- if it has an engine and a way to steer it, David, the original host of the popular TV series "Trucks!" brings it to life.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Stacey rolls in a well-worn '59 Chevy Apache pickup and shows how to approach a project, whether you are keeping it original or planning on modifying it.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Stacey digs into building a brand-new bed for the '59 Apache right beside the old one!

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Stacey goes out on the rails to take a look at the restoration of the 576 Steam Locomotive.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: The Thiokol Swamp Spryte is back in the shop for some much-needed restoration, and replacing the aluminum skin so she will float again; Stacey rolls in the Lil' Red Wagon for some new suspension and 50 years of Skyjacker history.

programme.title: Stacey David's GearZ
programme.desc: Stacey digs into the Joe Dirt side of things and how an old, beat up Daytona made it cool to drive old, rusty junk! After that, he shows what it takes to make a high-end replica of a down-and-dirty car.

programme.title: Off-Road Travel TV
programme.desc: Traveling with nomad Michael Ladden and his Drive the Globe expedition vehicle; heading to Utah to go dual sport riding; a look at the Glaciers to Geysers Trek: A Tale of Fire and Ice.

programme.title: Off-Road Travel TV
programme.desc: The team travels to Oregon for the Bend Overland Expo and visits places like Crater Lake National Park; testing the Opus OP15 off-road trailer which sleeps four and has a full outdoor kitchen and solar power to live off-grid.

programme.title: Off-Road Travel TV
programme.desc: Traveling to Whistler Canada to go mountain biking at North America's premiere mountain bike Park and going four wheeling; an inside look at project Toyota Tundra build for overlanding.

programme.title: Off-Road Travel TV
programme.desc: Hitting Alaska to go four wheeling, helicopter to a glacier to go dog sledding, then trying ziplining and taking a train ride; building a used 2017 Toyota 4Runner for overlanding, and showing why this SUV is so popular.

programme.title: Off-Road Travel TV
programme.desc: The team travels to Montana to go off-roading; Ken Faught takes flight and lands on a backcountry grass strip near Glacier National Park; testing Forest River's Nobo 16.6 Beast Mode off-road trailer.

programme.title: Off-Road Travel TV
programme.desc: The team hits Yellowstone National Park to see some natural wonders; testing vintage trailer works XTR off-road trailer and introducing Greg Amendola, a legend in the world of vehicle electronics.

programme.title: Off-Road Travel TV
programme.desc: The ORTTV team travels to Idaho to drive UTVs and ride the latest electric motorcycles; touring Pro Moto Billet where Wyatt Faught did a summer engineering internship; testing a Hiker Trailer built specifically for off-road.

programme.title: Off-Road Travel TV
programme.desc: The team tackles extreme terrain in Utah before breaking down and heading back to California for some quick repairs; we return to Utah with a new crew and hit infamous places like Swingarm City, Cathedral Valley, Monument Valley and more.

programme.title: Off-Road Travel TV
programme.desc: The ORTTV crew travels to Nelson Ghost Town outside of Las Vegas and shows you an inside look of a Ford Bronco Raptor build for overland; we also give a recap of our favorite moments during our 10,000-mile Alaska trip.

programme.title: Off-Road Travel TV
programme.desc: The ORTTV crew tests a Field Van Mercedes Sprinter on a four-state trip through the West Coast; Ken Faught travels to Maui to drive UTVs and then heads to the desert to ride some electric dirt bikes and check out Tim Robel's expedition vehicle.

programme.title: Off-Road Travel TV
programme.desc: We head to Sand Hallow State Park in Utah to go rock crawling with the national champ; Rob and Christjen Johnson test electric motorcycles in upstate New York; we head to Cabo San Lucas to explore this special part of Mexico in UTVs.

programme.title: Off-Road Travel TV
programme.desc: We go overlanding with a $150,000 Jeep and then show you the maintenance tips for your off-road trailer; accessories for transporting your dirt bike, ATV or UTV in a truck, van or toy hauler trailer.

programme.title: Off-Road Travel TV
programme.desc: Exploring the world of adventure motorcycles and showing the Editor's Choice for Must-Have Off-Road Products; a few surprises that will make you want to start planning an amazing off-road travel adventure.

programme.title: Dealer Life
programme.desc: Get to know Dan and the crew through a day in the life at a Harley-Davidson dealership; the crew rides over to Lucky's Saloon for Bike Night, sharing a glimpse of the rich culture behind the Harley-Davidson brand.

programme.title: Crush With Lee & Tiffany
programme.desc: "Crush With Lee & Tiffany" stars outdoor enthusiasts Lee and Tiffany Lakosky, a husband/wife team whose partnership begins in the home and extends to the woods of eastern Iowa and beyond. They love to bowhunt, and when they are not in New Mexico tracking elk or in North Carolina chasing turkeys -- among other travels -- they fulfill their passion for the sport on their Iowa farm, where they practice a strict land-management program for world-class white-tailed deer. "Let them go, let them grow," is a phrase the couple favors, but when the time comes to cull the herd, Lee and Tiffany demonstrate an uncanny ability to get the job done.

programme.title: Jim Shockey's Hunting Adventures
programme.desc: If it's an animal roaming the wild, Jim Shockey has probably hunted it. The veteran wilderness guide and outfitter has tracked game in more than 40 countries and taken in excess of 300 species using bow, muzzleloader and rifle. In addition, Shockey has exclusive guiding territories on Vancouver Island, in the Yukon Territory, in Mexico's Sonoran Desert, and in his native Saskatchewan, all of which helps supply content for the hunting adventures seen in this award-winning series. Jim's daughter Eva, a full-fledged hunter in her own right, joins her dad on many episodes.

programme.title: Bow Madness
programme.desc: Some of the world's best bowhunters are featured on "Bow Madness," where the action is furious but the thinking quite clear: archery-only, adrenaline-always. The hunts across North America are led by Mark and Terry Drury, whose love for the sport and the outdoors led to the merchandising company Drury Outdoors in 1989 and a second career in television. In addition to chasing trophy whitetail or elusive wild turkey on "Bow Madness," the Drurys also star in "Dream Season," "King of the Spring," "Winchester & Drury's Natural Born" and "Wildlife Obsession" on Outdoor Channel.

programme.title: Born to Hunt
programme.desc: The team takes viewers on adrenaline pumping adventures while travelling across North America.

programme.title: Heartland Bowhunter
programme.desc: Bowhunting in the heartland of the United States is at the heart of this series, which documents hunting adventures in Missouri, Kansas, Iowa, Nebraska, Illinois, South Dakota and North Dakota. Proud Missourians Michael Hunsucker and Shawn Luchtel lead many of the hunts -- Luchtel is also a cinematographer on the show -- and are often joined by friends, hunting guides and other special guests to track white-tailed deer, mule deer, elk, turkey and even geese.

programme.title: Crush With Lee & Tiffany
programme.desc: "Crush With Lee & Tiffany" stars outdoor enthusiasts Lee and Tiffany Lakosky, a husband/wife team whose partnership begins in the home and extends to the woods of eastern Iowa and beyond. They love to bowhunt, and when they are not in New Mexico tracking elk or in North Carolina chasing turkeys -- among other travels -- they fulfill their passion for the sport on their Iowa farm, where they practice a strict land-management program for world-class white-tailed deer. "Let them go, let them grow," is a phrase the couple favors, but when the time comes to cull the herd, Lee and Tiffany demonstrate an uncanny ability to get the job done.

programme.title: Bow Madness
programme.desc: Some of the world's best bowhunters are featured on "Bow Madness," where the action is furious but the thinking quite clear: archery-only, adrenaline-always. The hunts across North America are led by Mark and Terry Drury, whose love for the sport and the outdoors led to the merchandising company Drury Outdoors in 1989 and a second career in television. In addition to chasing trophy whitetail or elusive wild turkey on "Bow Madness," the Drurys also star in "Dream Season," "King of the Spring," "Winchester & Drury's Natural Born" and "Wildlife Obsession" on Outdoor Channel.

programme.title: Jim Shockey's Hunting Adventures
programme.desc: If it's an animal roaming the wild, Jim Shockey has probably hunted it. The veteran wilderness guide and outfitter has tracked game in more than 40 countries and taken in excess of 300 species using bow, muzzleloader and rifle. In addition, Shockey has exclusive guiding territories on Vancouver Island, in the Yukon Territory, in Mexico's Sonoran Desert, and in his native Saskatchewan, all of which helps supply content for the hunting adventures seen in this award-winning series. Jim's daughter Eva, a full-fledged hunter in her own right, joins her dad on many episodes.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E2 Trouble Street When Cheyenne rides into a town, the deputy quickly arrests him for no apparent reason. He discovers that the corrupt deputy arrests others passing through town and forces them to work at a local mine.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S2 E14 The Blood Line Todd Grayson arrives in town and is told that Ben Cartwright had killed his father. Ben shot Luke Grayson in self-defense, but Todd won't accept the truth. He wants to avenge his father by killing Ben.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E13 The Young Englishman Lucas and Mark discover a young calf is missing and traces it to the nearby Ashford Ranch run by an Englishman. When Lucas accuses foreman Norv Waggoner of cattle rustling to build up his own herd, Norv plans retaliation.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E14 The Gaucho Curge Palmer is upset after Argentinian Juan Argentez bought a ranch he wanted. Palmer insults Argentez and his children, Nita and Manolo. Meanwhile, Manolo's anger over who is courting Nita gets him into trouble when her suitor is found dead.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E15 The Pet Lucas and Mark find out a pony they adopted after the owner was killed may have anthrax. Fears of an epidemic rise in town. Meanwhile, the killer comes to the McCain Ranch thinking that Lucas has valuable information.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E16 The Sheridan Story At the end of the Civil War, General Sheridan and his staff arrive at the McCain Ranch. Trouble begins when ex-confederate soldier and hired hand Frank Blandon confronts the general, who shot and wounded him in the war.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S5 E4 Cash Cows First, the cowboys need to track down one of Bubba's most troublesome heifers before she can bust through his fence again. After briefly tending to business and family in Alabama, the guys head back to the Lone Star State to try and expand their network of contacts. Bubba, Cody, and Booger help their new friend Cash with a big Texas cattle drive in the hopes of both leading the herd to greener pastures and finding the big cattle deal they came west for. On the range they forge deeper bonds with their Texas counterparts, swapping cowboy stories around the campfire. But things take a turn for the worse when the herd overheats, and the creek they're all counting on has run dry as a bone. Back home, Jaclyn and Matthew are learning to love life on the ranch. Houseguest Andrew's disgusting habits have Kaley seeing red. And just as Misty gets back in the barrel-racing saddle, she starts to butt heads with her high-strung mare.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S5 E5 The Fall of Booger Bubba, Booger and Cody take an important step toward becoming big-time cattle brokers! The guys are roping and doctoring yearlings on the Texas range. But when Booger's most reliable horse Studly trips, smashing both horse and rider to the ground, Booger must rush out to find a vet and tend to his injured horse. Just as the cowboys are about to leave Texas, a local rancher makes them an offer they can't refuse. Will the guys gamble on a cattle deal, taking on a herd before they have a buyer lined up? Back home in Alabama, Kaley's patience reaches a breaking point as houseguest Andrew tracks in mud and expects a free lunch. To top it off, he then asks if his whole family can crash there while he searches for a permanent residence. Misty finds some extra help with her troublesome barrel-racing horse. Booger and Matthew are on the hunt for the perfect one-year anniversary gift for Jaclyn. But Booger may have a special surprise up his sleeve.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E1 The Vaqueros Mexican bandits attack Lucas and Mark for crossing their desert without paying. The group steals their horses, kidnaps Mark, and leaves Lucas to die in the desert. Lucas gets free and trails the banditos to a small village.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E2 First Wages Against Lucas' wishes, Mark gets a job at the livery stable in town. Lucas has doubts that Mark can both work and get his chores done on time. Mark finds himself in trouble when he takes a shortcut on an errand and meets a dangerous bank robber.

programme.title: The Legend of 5 Mile Cave
programme.desc: A boy enchanted with tales from the Old West unlocks a mystery that could save their family farm. While his widowed mother struggles to avoid foreclosure, a mysterious stranger arrives looking for a room to rent. A bond with the boy grows as the drifter recounts breathtaking stories of Shooter Green, a legendary gunslinger accused of Arizona's biggest gold robbery. The truth is revealed, along with the secret of the drifter's past when a crooked lawman appears, hot on the trail of the stolen gold. Past and present collide in this tale of action, adventure and drama. Stars Adam Baldwin (The Last Ship, Full Metal Jacket, The Patriot), Jeremy Sumpter (Peter Pan, Soul Surfer), Jill Wagner (Braven, Christmas Cookies), and Jet Jurgensmeyer (Last Man Standing, American Sniper).

programme.title: Savannah Sunrise
programme.desc: Joy Miles thinks she's taking a simple road trip to move her mother-in-law, Loraine, from Louisville to Savannah. Complete opposites, the two women manage to tolerate each other - barely. Type A+ personality, Joy is consumed with a high-stakes project at work. She has her days scheduled to the second. Now widowed, free-spirited Loraine is moving to a retirement community, no longer a preacher's wife, but a woman on her own. Her insights about life and family get under Joy's skin, challenging Joy to take a hard look at her whirlwind career and her priorities. As the weekend unfolds, with its outrageous adventures, hilarious encounters and heart-to-heart revelations, the women come to see each other through new eyes, and both women make an astounding discovery: they need each other more than they know.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E1 Winchester Quarantine Cheyenne meets a beautiful, feisty woman and helps her drive her herd of cattle to safety from a fever outbreak during a Texas quarantine. Despite her business struggles, he also finds himself falling in love with her.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E2 Trouble Street When Cheyenne rides into a town, the deputy quickly arrests him for no apparent reason. He discovers that the corrupt deputy arrests others passing through town and forces them to work at a local mine.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S2 E14 The Blood Line Todd Grayson arrives in town and is told that Ben Cartwright had killed his father. Ben shot Luke Grayson in self-defense, but Todd won't accept the truth. He wants to avenge his father by killing Ben.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E13 The Young Englishman Lucas and Mark discover a young calf is missing and traces it to the nearby Ashford Ranch run by an Englishman. When Lucas accuses foreman Norv Waggoner of cattle rustling to build up his own herd, Norv plans retaliation.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E14 The Gaucho Curge Palmer is upset after Argentinian Juan Argentez bought a ranch he wanted. Palmer insults Argentez and his children, Nita and Manolo. Meanwhile, Manolo's anger over who is courting Nita gets him into trouble when her suitor is found dead.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E15 The Pet Lucas and Mark find out a pony they adopted after the owner was killed may have anthrax. Fears of an epidemic rise in town. Meanwhile, the killer comes to the McCain Ranch thinking that Lucas has valuable information.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E16 The Sheridan Story At the end of the Civil War, General Sheridan and his staff arrive at the McCain Ranch. Trouble begins when ex-confederate soldier and hired hand Frank Blandon confronts the general, who shot and wounded him in the war.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S5 E6 Storm's A-Brewin' A storm is coming to The Cowboy Way! Cody visits his cousin Bo to secure steer for his upcoming rodeo, leaving Booger and Bubba to ear-tag some yearlings by themselves. Bubba takes the opportunity to put houseguest Andrew to work. Misty continues to try and shake off her barrel-racing rust, and comes to a serious crossroads with her misbehaving mare. Jaclyn presses Booger to put a timeline on finding them a permanent home. Bubba sets out on a solo trip back to Texas to check out a lead on a big herd of Tigerstripe cattle. But just when he's about to cross the state line, a devastating category 4 hurricane barrels down on Alabama. All the cowboys' best-laid plans come to a screeching halt. Bubba must decide whether to turn around and head home, or push through for the big deal. Finding themselves directly in the path of the hurricane, everyone scrambles to prepare their ranches for the worst. Can the cowboys and their families safely ride out the storm?

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S5 E7 Horsing Around Cody's rodeo is fast approaching and time is running out, so the cowboys head out to scout talent for the team-roping event. Misty's new barrel-racing horse has taken her training to a whole new level. So when Booger starts teasing her, she challenges him to a one-on-one race: cowboy vs barrel racer! Misty also comes up with a potential rodeo venue, so Cody heads out to Bay Minette, AL to lock down a site. Bubba and Kaley prepare for houseguest Andrew's family to arrive. Will Andrew finally find his own place, and get out of Kaley's hair? Meanwhile, the guys' reputation as cattle brokers starts to flourish. Booger gets a lead on a healthy herd of cattle in Texas, and the guys consider if they should go all-in and buy the entire herd. Booger heads back to the Lone Star State and strikes a deal that seems to be a win-win. But just as the guys get the ball rolling with another big deal, a phone call from their buyer puts everything in jeopardy.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E3 Sheer Terror Lucas stands guard at the North Fork Bank when $50,000 arrives in a specially designed stagecoach strongbox. Two gunmem who plan to ambush and rob the stage take Milly and Mark hostage in the general store, which doubles as their headquarters.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E4 The Stand-In Two prison wagon drivers stop at the McCain Ranch looking for whiskey. Lucas refuses since they are taking a murderer named Rudy Croft to be hanged in Yuma. Later, Croft escapes and the guards take Lucas as their prisoner.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E9 The Prizefighter When Jim Bridger's second-in-command begins enforcing camp discipline with brutal violence, one trapper pushes back, and a showdown seems inevitable. Can Bridger intervene before the situation turns from mutual hostility into cold-blooded murder?

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E10 A Shard of Glass Haunted by the memory of leaving a man to die, mountain man Jim Bridger is determined not to repeat the mistake. When his trapping party runs out of water while crossing a barren desert, Bridger struggles desperately to keep his companions alive.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E10 Willie Kennard Makes His Mark in History Under siege by gunslingers, the gold mining town of Yankee Hill runs a newspaper advertisement to find a new marshal. Former slave and Union soldier Willie Kennard answers the ad, but he faces prejudice and doubt as he works to restore law and order.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E11 John Wesley Hardin: Killer on the Texas Frontier When outlaw John Wesley Hardin murders a sheriff, a hard-charging Texas Ranger joins forces with a cool-headed police detective to hunt the killer. The unlikely duo must learn how to work together to end Hardin's reign of terror once and for all.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E4 Lewis & Clark: Captains of Discovery Under orders from President Jefferson to explore America's vast unknown frontier, Meriwether Lewis and William Clark lead an expedition up the Missouri River in an attempt to reach the Pacific Ocean...a journey no American has made before, and one that may not even be possible. Leaving Fort Mandan after their first winter on the frontier, the Corps of Discovery enters completely uncharted territory. But as the waterways they travel become too shallow for boats, Lewis and Clark desperately seek the Shoshone tribe and their horses. To communicate with the elusive tribe, they rely on Sacagawea, a 16-year-old Shoshone woman, who accompanies the expedition with her newborn son. Lewis and Clark hope Sacagawea will help them trade for the Shoshone's horses, which will provide the only means of crossing the forbidding Rocky Mountains before winter returns.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E20 Face of the Enemy Teaspoon's old friend, war hero Colonel Matthew Curtis, orders an attack on the Sioux delegation after they ambush his men. The townspeople are in danger when the Sioux threatens to retaliate. It turns out that another tribe is responsible.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E3 Cross Purpose Cheyenne finds himself involved in a dispute regarding dead war hero, Colonel Charles DeVier. Many believe the Comanches killed him, but the discovery of the hero's body and the disappearance of Captain Robert Holman leads Cheyenne to the truth.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E4 The Young Fugitives Cheyenne visits old friend Frank Collins who is in a wheelchair. He sees that townspeople are taunting Frank's loner son, Gilby. Gilby enters a circus shooting contest in town. Tragedy ensues when Gilby shoots a man. Cheyenne must stop a lynch mob.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S2 E15 The Courtship Joe and Hoss travel to Sacramento to visit Helen, the widow of Ben's friend, Josh Layton. Hoss falls in love with her and intends to marry her. All are thrilled except Adam, who has reason to believe that she is using Hoss.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E17 The Retired Gun Wes Carney, a famous gunfighter, and his new wife Clair move to North Fork. They open a store and settle down. However, three outlaws come to town to challenge him. Carney refuses and they ransack his store, forcing him to put his gunbelt back on.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E18 The Photographer Abel Goss is doing a portrait of Mark standing on a North Fork street. Suddenly he sees Colonel Whiteside and his sidekick, Jamison. When he recognizes them as the cruel men who tortured him in a Civil War prison camp, problems soon arise.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E19 Shivaree A young couple traveling to Yuma to get married come across Aaron Pelser's wagon train. Pelser and his group take things too far by forcing them to marry in North Fork, which is not the friendly spirit for a shivaree. Lucas steps in to help.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E20 The Deadeye Kid After witnessing a murder, 16 year-old Donnel O'Mahoney panics and comes to the McCain Ranch. A posse is on the hunt for the young man, believing he commited the crime. Mark befriends and hides O'Mahoney, who is traveling west from New York.

programme.desc: S1 E20 The Deadeye Kid After witnessing a murder, 16 year-old Donnel O'Mahoney panics and comes to the McCain Ranch. A posse is on the hunt for the young man, believing he commited the crime. Mark befriends and hides O'Mahoney, who is traveling west from New York.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S5 E8 Kiddie Corral The cowboys step a little outside of their comfort zones. Looking to offload their new herd, the guys head down to the local stockyard to hone their bartering skills. Cody bounces a crazy rodeo idea off the boys - then uses them guinea pigs. Bubba plans a short getaway with Kaley, but there's a big catch: Booger's been tapped as the babysitter, with Jaclyn lending a helping hand. Kaley wonders if Booger is up to the challenge. His first attempts to feed and dress little Andie suggest he most certainly is not! While Bubba and Kaley aren't sure they'll return home to find everything in one piece, they do get some great news from houseguest Andrew. Cody is desperate to find the final missing piece for his rodeo: an announcer. While Booger adamant that he's the perfect man for the job, Cody has to resort to using reverse psychology on his old friend to avoid disaster.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S5 E9 Ride 'Em High Will all the hard work the cowboys put in this season finally pay off? Cody is hoping the people of Bay Minette will come out in droves to make his rodeo a rousing success, while Misty puts on her game face to take another shot at barrel-racing glory. Andrew's bags are finally packed and he's clearing out. Though Bubba and Kaley hate to see him go, they also love watching him leave! Since the cowboys have been buying cattle left and right, word's gotten out about the Faith Cattle Company's trading business. This leads to Booger and Bubba boarding a private jet to meet some Texas investors looking to place a make-or-break order. As the guys hustle to gather all the cattle in time, they find themselves bidding against an old friend at the sale barn. Rodeo night brings all the families together - and even Andrew makes a surprise appearance. As the season draws to a close, the cowboys have everything on the line: their own money, as well as their reputations.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E5 The Journey Back Mark takes a job on new neighbor Will Temple's ranch but is taken back by Temple's badly scarred face. When a cavalry officer stops by the McCain Ranch looking for a deserter who committed murder, both Mark and Lucas question who Temple really is.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E6 The Decision While repairing a fence on his property, Lucas witnesses a murder. The killer, Corey Hazlett, is the son of a wealthy rancher named Frank Hazlett. When Lucas agrees to testify at Corey's trial, there are threats to harm Mark.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E1 They Killed Me Frontiersman Jim Bridger spins an incredible tale to a group of settlers, claiming he was once killed by Blackfeet warriors yet somehow lived to tell the tale. They think he's joking, but Bridger soon proves that he really did rise from the dead.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E4 Brothers in Arms When they are ambushed by a Blackfeet war party, Jim Bridger and a lone Shoshone brave must work together to find a way to defeat their common enemy. If they can't overcome their suspicions and learn to trust each other, they may not survive the day.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E5 Wong Fee Lee Stakes His Claim Chinese immigrant Wong Fee Lee joins a convoy of miners headed to Deadwood, where he hopes to strike gold and start a business. But when the Black Hills Bandits stand in their way, Wong must find the strength to lead his fellow prospectors in battle.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E9 Law Comes to No Man's Land Marshal Chris Madsen helps newly appointed judge John Buford bring law and order to Oklahoma's Panhandle in an area known as No Man's Land. After escorting a wagon train of prisoners to Beaver City, they set up their first courthouse inside a saloon.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E1 John Colter: King of the Mountain Men As a member of Lewis and Clark's Corps of Discovery, John Colter travels from the Missouri River all the way to the Pacific Ocean, but he decides not to return to the civilized East when the expedition ends. Entranced by the beauty and adventure of the wild frontier, he becomes one of America's first mountain men. As a hunter, trapper and explorer in his own right, he's the first American to see the Grand Tetons and the epic Yellowstone Valley. While his epic explorations make him famous, it's a harrowing ordeal with Blackfeet warriors that makes him a legend. After boldly venturing into territory controlled by the Blackfeet tribe, Colter is captured, stripped naked, and forced to run for his life as warriors give chase in what will come to be known as Colter's Run.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E1 A House Divided After the destruction of a Pony Express station in Rock Creek, Teaspoon, The Kid, and Jimmy receive an assignment to rebuild it. They must relocate and learn the new territory near town as well as the neighbors in the area.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E5 Day's Pay Cheyenne arrives in a town held hostage by a gang of bandits. Outlaw Luis Boladas kills young, inexperienced Sheriff Billy Fipps. The town wants to lynch Boladas, but Cheyenne discovers he once saved him from hanging.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E6 Retaliation Sheriff Cheyenne Bodie is out of town visiting widow Cora Ainslie and her son Bart. A group of men robs the bank and blows up a train trestle while he is away. Cheyenne discovers that banker Thackery Smith rules the town, and many are not happy.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S2 E16 The Spitfire Joe finds a man burning Ponderosa land and shoots him in self-defense. Joe is left with the responsibility of the man's daughter. He brings her to the Ponderosa, unaware of her outlaw kin searching for her.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E21 The Indian U.S. Marshal Sam Buckhart escorts an Indian prisoner back east to stand trial. They arrive in North Fork and Lucas finds out that Buckhart is also an Indian who was educated at Harvard. Angry townspeople try to take matters into their own hands.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E22 The Boarding House Julia Andueza opens a boarding house in North Fork. Lucas remembers her as a dishonest card dealer from the past. Her old boss arrives and tries to bully Julia into turning her business into a gambling house. Lucas realizes she has changed her ways.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E23 The Second Witness Lucas' life is in danger after he agrees to testify in a murder case in another town. The only other witness was killed, and when a gun-toting stranger appears at the McCain Ranch, Lucas now finds himself in grave danger.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E24 The Trade Outlaw Sam Morley, an old friend, comes to the McCain Ranch. He asks Lucas to turn in him for the $500 reward and use the money to pay for his girlfriend's medical care. However, a bounty hunter has other ideas.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E22 The Boarding House Julia Andueza opens a boarding house in North Fork. Lucas remembers her as a dishonest card dealer from the past. Her old boss arrives and tries to bully Julia into turning her business into a gambling house. Lucas realizes she has changed her ways.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E23 The Second Witness Lucas' life is in danger after he agrees to testify in a murder case in another town. The only other witness was killed, and when a gun-toting stranger appears at the McCain Ranch, Lucas now finds himself in grave danger.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E24 The Trade Outlaw Sam Morley, an old friend, comes to the McCain Ranch. He asks Lucas to turn in him for the $500 reward and use the money to pay for his girlfriend's medical care. However, a bounty hunter has other ideas.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S6 E1 Drone'T Knock It 'Til You Try It A ranching job in Texas inspires Cody to try and modernize their business with the help of technology, but Booger and Bubba are hesitant that it will be successful. Booger visits Matthew's school during parent's week to teach his classmates about cowboying. Bubba struggles with being away from his family for work and feels the pressure to keep their business close to home. A life-changing opportunity for Booger to compete at a world-renowned colt-starting competition leaves Cody and Bubba excited for their friend, but nervous about what it will mean for their business.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S6 E2 Obstacle Horse, of Course of Course With no plans on how to expand their business in sight, the cowboys head to Texas for work. After attending a special cattle sale for Misty's business, Full Moon Cattle, Cody comes up with a possible new business venture. Booger begins training for the Road to the Horse competition, but things don't go smoothly. Feeling like he's in over his head, he receives good advice from an unexpected source. A hand injury affects how much work Bubba can do, but he uses the downtime to build a mock obstacle course for Booger. Kaley tells Bubba about her desire to get into real estate and encourages him to think about a possible career change. Booger challenges Misty to compete against him in the obstacle course, and Jaclyn receives a crash course in barrel racing.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E7 Knight Errant Two old friends of Lucas', Don Chumera De Lardo and Colonel Black, come to the McCain Ranch. They are there to finish a deed of honor, even insisting on a jousting match. Lucas learns that the feud started over a chess game.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E8 Honest Abe A neighbor of Lucas' believes he is Abe Lincoln after being mentally injured in the Civil War. Townspeople go along with his impersonation since he is a kind man. However, when a saloon patron makes fun of him, trouble ensues.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E2 The Spirit of Truth After his fur trapping expedition is surprised by a Crow war party, legendary mountain man Jim Bridger suddenly finds himself in a desperate struggle to rescue his fellow trappers when one of them goes missing, and another is on the brink of madness.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E3 The Fossil Feud When bloodthirsty Canadian trappers try to kill him, mountain man Jim Bridger takes cover in an unexplored valley. There, he runs headlong into a family of escaped slaves who show him the huge footprints and fossilized bones of long-dead monsters.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S4 E12 The Battle of Stone Corral When bandits rob a train and gun down a pursuing marshal, they spark one of the largest manhunts in California history. After taking shelter behind the crumbling walls of Stone Corral, they make their final stand against a hail of gunfire.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E1 The Bandit Queen Once a feared gunfighter and sheriff, the legendary Bat Masterson is now working as a newspaperman. He heads west again to uncover the real story of Pearl Hart, the first woman to rob a stagecoach in the Old West. Masterson tracks down Pearl's partner-in-crime, Joe Boot, who shares every daring and surprising detail from his wild days with the notorious Bandit Queen. In a time when outlaws and gunslingers captured the fascination of the American public, Pearl Hart was living proof that in the Wild West a woman could be just as infamous as a man.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S1 E2 Jim Bridger: Forged on the Frontier With dreams of fortune and adventure, an 18-year-old Jim Bridger joins William Ashley's expedition to trap beaver along the Missouri River. But a grim ordeal soon forces Bridger to weigh his morals against the harsh reality of survival in the wild. A vicious grizzly bear attack leaves fellow trapper and hunter Hugh Glass on the verge of death and completely dependent upon Bridger's care. As a hostile band of Arikara warriors begins to close in, Bridger must choose between staying with the dying man and risking certain death, or leaving his injured comrade alone in the woods and fleeing to safety. In what becomes a legendary tale of the wild frontier, Bridger wrestles to choose between right and wrong, knowing the harsh retribution that will follow if he makes the wrong choice.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E2 Jesse A young man named Jesse is out for revenge on a gang of outlaws responsible for his guardian's death. The riders befriend and protect Jesse by stepping in and taking him to Rock Creek before it is too late.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E7 Storm Center Cheyenne arrives in Devil's Gorge just in time for a bank robbery. After he kills one of the robbers, he becomes a hero. An orphan boy comes to Cheyenne hoping that he can help him find his parents. When the boy goes missing, Cheyenne must find him.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E8 Legacy of the Lost After visiting White Cloud's camp with detective Dennis Carter, Cheyenne learns that he is the son of wealthy landowner, Lionel Abbot. He travels to Wyoming to find his family and repair tensions between White Cloud and Abbot.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: S1 E1 The Gunmen While in Texas, Joe and Hoss are mistaken for the Slade brothers who are involved in a feud between two families. In order to stop the fighting, they decide to turn to the women of the families for help.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E25 One Went to Denver Tom Birch, an old childhood friend, comes to visit Lucas unexpectedly. Birch promises he is just passing through on his way to Denver. But Lucas soon finds out about a plot to rob the North Fork Bank and must choose between friendship and justice.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E26 The Deadly Wait Just released from prison, Dan Maury comes to North Fork in search of Marshal Micah Torrance, who helped get him locked up. Torrance carries a shotgun everywhere he goes, but Maury plans to wait him out.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E27 The Wrong Man A crooked marshal comes to North Fork looking for a wanted man. He finds a man fitting the futitive's description. He deliberately kills the wrong man to collect the bounty and then blackmails the real outlaw, who wants to keep his past hidden.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E28 The Challenge An escaped killer wants to prove he hasn't lost his nerve when he holds up North Fork's General Store and takes Marshal Micah Torrance hostage. He provokes the town to try to face him, but only Lucas is strong enough to rise up to his challenge.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way

programme.desc: S1 E28 The Challenge An escaped killer wants to prove he hasn't lost his nerve when he holds up North Fork's General Store and takes Marshal Micah Torrance hostage. He provokes the town to try to face him, but only Lucas is strong enough to rise up to his challenge.

programme.title: Angel and the Badman
programme.desc: When a gunslinger with a bad disposition is nursed back to health and desired by a Quaker girl, he finds himself having to choose between his lawless life or the peaceful world of his newfound love.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E9 The Long Goodbye Stubborn Grandpa Fogerty lives in a rundown house with his grandson, Woody. Lucas tries to get the old man to send the boy to school. The ladies of North Fork want Woody removed from the home and ask Lucas to help them.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E10 The Shattered Idol Famous writer Mark Twain visits North Fork and Mark, who idolizes him, is hurt by his rudeness. Lucas intervenes and discovers the source of Twain's bitterness comes from personal tragedy. Later, both Marks become friends.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E2 The Conspirators Cheyenne travels to Washington, DC, to work on a special undercover assignment for the Army. He poses as a traveling stage actor named Jim Merritt in order to stop the Confederate Army's reorganization.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E21 Two Ounces of Tin A gunman named Tip Corey, whose father was allegedly murdered in North Fork, rides into town and threatens to kill Marshal Micah Torrance. Corey gives Micah an ultimatum: take his badge off or he will end his life.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E19 Face of Yesterday Lucas thinks he has seen a ghost when he comes face-to-face with Simon Lee, a young man who looks exactly like a Confederate officer he killed during the Civil War. Simon Lee is fast with a gun, and provokes Lucas into a life and death situation.

programme.title: Abilene Town
programme.desc: It's the late 1800s and a marshal must stop a volatile and growing conflict between homesteaders and cattle drivers in his small town on the Kansas frontier.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E7 Lone Gun Amarillo Ames asks Cheyenne to help drive a herd of cattle to Dodge City and take over the mission if he perishes. When Ames dies, Cheyenne must forcefully take on the Laverson brothers, who do not want him in charge of the drive.

programme.title: Only the Valiant
programme.desc: A cavalry officer is blamed by his men and his lady for the death of a popular officer. Now, he must find a way to stop an Indian attack on their fort. It might prove to be the only way to regain the trust of his men and the affection of his woman.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E33 Death Trap Lucas and Mark find a wounded man and bring him into North Fork to save his life. Lucas asks Simon Battle, a gunfighter-turned-doctor, to help the man. The wounded man's enemies have other plans in store.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E8 Mark's Rifle Marty Blair rides into North Fork to promote a circus coming out west from Ohio. Blair is soon under suspicion when there is an attempted robbery at the hotel. Mark finds it hard to believe that Blair is guilty, however, Lucas feels differently.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E3 The Mutton Puncher An attractive businesswoman named Thora Flagg needs help to move her herd of sheep into town. However, cattle boss Ben Creed, who is Cheyenne's boss, stands in the way. During a poker game, Cheyenne finds himself caught in the middle.

programme.title: Angel and the Badman
programme.desc: When a gunslinger with a bad disposition is nursed back to health and desired by a Quaker girl, he finds himself having to choose between his lawless life or the peaceful world of his newfound love.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E9 The Long Goodbye Stubborn Grandpa Fogerty lives in a rundown house with his grandson, Woody. Lucas tries to get the old man to send the boy to school. The ladies of North Fork want Woody removed from the home and ask Lucas to help them.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E10 The Shattered Idol Famous writer Mark Twain visits North Fork and Mark, who idolizes him, is hurt by his rudeness. Lucas intervenes and discovers the source of Twain's bitterness comes from personal tragedy. Later, both Marks become friends.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E2 The Conspirators Cheyenne travels to Washington, DC, to work on a special undercover assignment for the Army. He poses as a traveling stage actor named Jim Merritt in order to stop the Confederate Army's reorganization.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S4 E21 Two Ounces of Tin A gunman named Tip Corey, whose father was allegedly murdered in North Fork, rides into town and threatens to kill Marshal Micah Torrance. Corey gives Micah an ultimatum: take his badge off or he will end his life.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E19 Face of Yesterday Lucas thinks he has seen a ghost when he comes face-to-face with Simon Lee, a young man who looks exactly like a Confederate officer he killed during the Civil War. Simon Lee is fast with a gun, and provokes Lucas into a life and death situation.

programme.title: Abilene Town
programme.desc: It's the late 1800s and a marshal must stop a volatile and growing conflict between homesteaders and cattle drivers in his small town on the Kansas frontier.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E7 Lone Gun Amarillo Ames asks Cheyenne to help drive a herd of cattle to Dodge City and take over the mission if he perishes. When Ames dies, Cheyenne must forcefully take on the Laverson brothers, who do not want him in charge of the drive.

programme.title: Only the Valiant
programme.desc: A cavalry officer is blamed by his men and his lady for the death of a popular officer. Now, he must find a way to stop an Indian attack on their fort. It might prove to be the only way to regain the trust of his men and the affection of his woman.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E33 Death Trap Lucas and Mark find a wounded man and bring him into North Fork to save his life. Lucas asks Simon Battle, a gunfighter-turned-doctor, to help the man. The wounded man's enemies have other plans in store.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S3 E3 The Mutton Puncher An attractive businesswoman named Thora Flagg needs help to move her herd of sheep into town. However, cattle boss Ben Creed, who is Cheyenne's boss, stands in the way. During a poker game, Cheyenne finds himself caught in the middle.

programme.title: The Warrant
programme.desc: Sheriff John Breaker and his son, Cal, reunite after the Civil War to track down a fellow veteran, now a notorious gang leader. Their mission turns dangerous when they find themselves caught between their former friend's outlaw gang and the vigilantes who are taking the law into their own hands. Starring Neal McDonough (Yellowstone, Captain America), Casper Van Dien (Starship Troopers, Tarzan), Steven R. McQueen (The Vampire Diaries, Chicago Fire), and Annabeth Gish (X-Files, The Haunting of Hill House).

programme.desc: Business Today is an Asian-Pacific television program, which began airing on the Asia-pacific channel Australia Network in August 2006, and on ABC News 24 on 23 July 2010. programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: Cash Cab
programme.desc: In this offbeat game show, players picked up in the Cash Cab have to answer trivia questions with mounting cash values before they reach their destination in order to win. If a player answers incorrectly three times, he is kicked out of the cab without any money. Help options include a Mobile Shout-Out (phone call) and Street Shout-Out (asking a stranger on the street). Once the player reaches his destination, he can leave the cab with his winnings, if any, or risk them on a more difficult question. A correct final answer doubles his winnings; an incorrect answer means he leaves the cab with no money at all. Comic Ben Bailey takes the cab's wheel as host.

programme.title: Cash Cab

programme.title: The $100,000 Pyramid
programme.desc: Two teams of two compete in a word-association game. Each contestant gets a celebrity partner, and one partner provides clues to the other about six mystery words, leaving the other to guess those words before the time runs out. The team with the most points gets to play in the winners circle, where the top prize is $100,000. Michael Strahan hosts.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire
programme.desc: Contestants answer increasingly difficult multiple-choice questions to win cash -- up to $1 million, or even more in certain episodes. Along the way, contestants have "lifelines" they can use to help them answer the questions, including asking the studio audience for help.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: A contestant must choose from 26 sealed briefcases containing a marker for various amounts of cash from one penny to $1 million. The player then eliminates the remaining 25 cases one by one. The chosen ones are opened and the amount of money inside revealed. After several cases are opened, the player is tempted by the Banker to accept an offer of cash in exchange for not continuing the game and possibly winning a larger sum of money.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Contestants guess hidden phrases by guessing letters one at a time. Contestants win money or prizes, as determined by a spin of the wheel, for each correct consonant they guess. But they have to pay to see what vowels are in a puzzle. The contestant that has amassed the most winnings at the end of a game goes on to play the bonus round, in which the player can win even more -- prizes frequently seen in the bonus round include automobiles, vacations and more cash.
